div.div: The system should be separated by concerns.

div.style: font-size: 23px;
font-size: 23px;

div.div: A concern is a logical section within the program, also called, module (not necessarily the source file). A module can be a data structure, function, source file, folder, package, or service for instance

div.div: The architecture should start at the first level and advance to next levels as issues starts to appear. The architecture should also be able to go backwards. From the third to the first level, according to deployment, development, operational and use cases issues

switch.text: The architecture should start at the first level and advance to next...

div.div:
Identifying the Horizontal Layers that change in different rates, and
decouple them into different units of deployment (Jar, DLL, Wheels), to
support some of the 4 main concerns

switch.text: Identifying the Horizontal Layers that change in different rates, and...

div.div: The separation of concerns gotta be applied to the other levels too, even if you have to break the system into different deployment units
